metadata.Title: CVE-2012-4503 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
cmdmon.c in Chrony before 1.29 allows remote attackers to obtainpotentially sensitive information from stack memory via vectors related to(1) an invalid subnet in a RPY_SUBNETS_ACCESSED command to thehandle_subnets_accessed function or (2) a RPY_CLIENT_ACCESSES command tothe handle_client_accesses function when client logging is disabled, whichcauses uninitialized data to be included in a reply.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4503` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chrony - 1.29-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chrony package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.29-1').
